items.content_html:
💻 I just blogged: Ever exported your Apple Distribution certificate and hit the dreaded RC2-40-CBC error when setting up CI/CD? I did — and it nearly derailed my GitHub Actions setup.

Here’s how I extracted, repackaged, and fixed it for good: msicc.net/exporting…

If you’re signing iOS apps in CI, this might save you hours.

#AppleDev #GitHubActions #iOSDev #MAUI #CI_CD #CodeSigning
items.content_text:
💻 I just blogged:
Ever exported your Apple Distribution certificate and hit the dreaded RC2-40-CBC error when setting up CI/CD? I did — and it nearly derailed my GitHub Actions setup.

Here’s how I extracted, repackaged, and fixed it for good:
[msicc.net/exporting...](https://msicc.net/exporting-apple-distribution-certificates-for-cicd-the-right-way/)

If you’re signing iOS apps in CI, this might save you hours.

 #AppleDev #GitHubActions #iOSDev #MAUI #CI_CD #CodeSigning

items.content_html:
Today’s #race (11.4km): 🏃‍♂️

Laufsporttag Winterthur (ZKB Zürilauf Cup)

Got stuck on the first hill in a slow group… took me some time to overcome them. Had problems to find my pace again. Still, this race felt good in the end, as the second half went a lot better. Still somewhat frustrated that I did not manage to go under the 1h mark for the race.

strava.app.link/NPyjbPcYn…

#running #corsa # laufen #AppleWatch #Strava

items.title: Hello IndieWeb world!
items.content_html:
Who’s talking ? 👋

My name is Marco Siccardi, 40+ guy and father of two young adults and husband of a wonderful and patient wife.

I am a .NET Software Developer, currently focused on mobile app development for iOS at my daytime job. In my spare time, I am learning Swift and SwiftUI to progress on my journey as a software developer.

Interests

Here is a (incomplete) list of things you can expect to read about from me:

  • Programming Stuff (C#/.NET, Swift/SwiftUI) 💻
  • Progress of my side projects (mostly app development) 📱
  • Learning progress 🎓
  • Rants, mostly about dev problems 🤬
  • Running (training log, race reviews, etc.) 🏃‍♂️
  • Photos I take, trying to use the full potential of my iPhone 15 Pro Max 📷
  • Sharing interesting links in different areas (space 🚀, science 🔬, environment 🌍, and programming of course)

Why micro.blog?

One of my side project ideas was a website to show off my photos to avoid social networks. I would also let them being posted automatically to my social network accounts, of course. The item sleeps on my to-do list like forever. On top, I was thinking about how I can consolidate all my fragmented social accounts after my Twitter x-odus.

Turns out, I am late to the game of POSSE. This week, I learned about micro.blog while listening to @hanselman.com’s Hanselminutes podcast, where he talked to @manton. It may be all I ever wanted in this space plus some more features I haven’t thought of untli now.

Other places

While exploring the possibilities migro.blog provides, I will still be active on my existing platforms. Here’s a list of where you can find me outside this space here:

  • Personal Blog
  • Portfolio
  • Strava
  • Mastodon (thinking about migrating to migro.blog)
  • Bluesky
  • Pixelfed
  • Threads
items.content_text:
### Who's talking ? 👋
My name is Marco Siccardi, 40+ guy and father of two young adults and husband of a wonderful and patient wife.

I am a .NET Software Developer, currently focused on mobile app development for iOS at my daytime job. In my spare time, I am learning Swift and SwiftUI to progress on my journey as a software developer.

### Interests
Here is a (incomplete) list of things you can expect to read about from me:
 * Programming Stuff (C#/.NET, Swift/SwiftUI) 💻
 * Progress of my side projects (mostly app development) 📱
 * Learning progress 🎓
 * Rants, mostly about dev problems 🤬
 * Running (training log, race reviews, etc.) 🏃‍♂️
 * Photos I take, trying to use the full potential of my iPhone 15 Pro Max 📷
 * Sharing interesting links in different areas (space 🚀, science 🔬, environment 🌍, and programming of course)

### Why micro.blog?
One of my side project ideas was a website to show off my photos to avoid social networks.  I would also let them being posted automatically to my social network accounts, of course. The item sleeps on my to-do list like forever.  On top, I was thinking about how I can consolidate all my fragmented social accounts after my Twitter x-odus. 

Turns out, I am late to the game of [POSSE](https://indieweb.org/POSSE). This week, I learned about micro.blog while listening to @hanselman.com's [Hanselminutes](https://podcasts.apple.com/ch/podcast/hanselminutes-with-scott-hanselman/id117488860?i=1000689740022) podcast, where he talked to @manton. It may be all I ever wanted in this space plus some more features I haven't thought of untli now. 

### Other places
While exploring the possibilities migro.blog provides, I will still be active on my existing platforms. Here's a list of where you can find me outside this space here:
 * [Personal Blog](https://msicc.net)
 * [Portfolio](https://msiccdev.net)
 * [Strava](https://www.strava.com/athletes/89119922)
 * [Mastodon (thinking about migrating to migro.blog)](https://dotnet.social/@MSicc)
 * [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/msicc.net)
 * [Pixelfed](https://pixelfed.social/@msicc1)
 * [Threads](https://www.threads.net/@msicc1)
